description.narrative: Cambodian Youth Network (CYN) is implementing a project called " Enabling environment for youth and community participation in Mekong Water Governance." The Oxfam water governance funded project will focus on planned large scale hydropower dam in Sambor district,Kratie province. CYN shall intervene through strategic activities focusing on water resource dependent community#s livelihood evidence documentation, promote human rights-based approach and raising awareness on impact of hydro-power dam development that will affect local communities. This project empowers community to participate in water resource management decision making through exercisingtheir rights to advocate for better water governance in the Mekong. The project targets community and youth focal persons in 6 communes in Sambor district of Kratie province, where a planned large-scale hydropower plant has been announced, and university student youths for networking, capacity building, awareness raising, using social media and community action research to inform policy influencing and encourage their engaging in water governance. This project contributes the achieve Oxfam Mekong Regional Water GovernanceProgram on strengthening the capacity of civil society to hold the government and developers accountable and contribute to Oxfam inCambodia Natural Resource Governance program#s objective 1 to empower communities including youths, women and indigenous people to realise their rights to challenge decision making in regard water resource governance. The project#s overall objective (goal) is to increase youth and community engagement in Mekong water governance. The specific objective is to increase youth and community#s capacity and opportunity to raise their voices related to Mekong water governance. The project comprises 3 main outcomes 1) organized and strengthened youth and community network; 2) increased youth and community#s awareness and capacity on water governance and 3) increased youth and community participation/engagement in advocacy and campaign on water governance.

participating-org.narrative: Cambodian Youth Network (CYN) was established in October 31, 2009 by a group of students from four different universities to undertake and advocate development issues in the Cambodian society in the form of voluntary basis. CYN is not affiliated with anypoliticalparty or religion. CYN is named a social movement among Cambodian youths. The main factors of youth network establishment are social issues among youths including a lack of various knowledge, skills, willingness, solidarity, a limited concentration on culture preservation, a short of space for learning and sharing and currently inhumanity activities such as human rights violation and land grabbing etc. Currently, CYN has been collaborating with partner organizations in doing activities to buildyouth capacity, youth empowerment and youth#s civil and political engagement and participation in advocacy activities to demand, promote and protect the human rights. Goal: Youth have its strong and active network to participate in social activities to demand respect of human rights, social justice, environment protection and equitable development. Vision: Cambodian youth are empowered, able to exercise full right and freedom, and live with dignity in a democratic society. Mission: CYN organizes, develops capacity, empowers youth and advocate for good governance, social justice, respect human rights and sustainable use natural resources in the Cambodian society.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
The right to social and political participation
